alert.note: Alert for Mecosta; Newaygo (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 29 at 8:13PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT FRIDAY... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Michigan and west central Michigan, including the following counties, in central Michigan, Mecosta. In west central Michigan, Newaygo. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from heavy rainfall. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 811 PM EDT, Radar and automated rain gauges indicate heavy rain continuing. Many locations have received between 3.5 and 4.5 inches of rain over the last few hours, with an additional inch of rain possible before the rain ends later this evening. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... White Cloud, Hesperia, Morley, Canadian Lakes, Stanwood, Woodville, Croton Heights, Wooster and Altona. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
